comments:
Build: 20020214

Description:
Expanding a node in a table tree with the mouse works fine, but using the 
keyboard causes null pointer exceptions.  I poked through the code and compared 
TableTree.onKeyDown(Event) to TableTree.onMouseDown(Event).  I think the 
problem in onKeyDown is the event that is passed to Widget.notifyListeners.  In 
onMouseDown, event.item is initialized to the TreeItem which is being 
expanded.  In onKeyDown, event.item is left as null.  

Steps:
1.  Run Eclipse with the org.eclipse.ui.examples.propertysheet plugin loaded.
2.  Create a file foo.usr somewhere in the workspace.
3.  Click on this file in the navigator, an outline appears in the outliner.
4.  Drill down in the outline to select the name of a person.
5.  If the properties view is not already open, open it.
6.  In the properties view, expand a node by clicking on the [+] with your 
mouse.  This works properly.
7.  Select another row in the table that has children but do not expand it.
8.  If an editor for the property value becomes active, pres Esc to dismiss the 
editor.
9.  Press the right arrow key to expand the node.  This causes a null pointer 
exception.

Stack Trace:
